My cousin is called Jerry
You're saying it wrong, it is not MEGABYTES per second, it is MEGABITS per second. 2 Megabytes p/s is actually sufficient for most internet use, even decent video. 2MBps is the same as 16Mbps. Mbps is what service providers like to use when they talk about internet speed because 16Mbps sounds better than 2MBps. Sadly the vast majority of people say megabytes, which is incorrect. When people say they get 100 megabytes p/s for their home service they are mistaken, as 100MBps is actually 800Mbps.

If you think Crysâ€™s review is bad, check out Kimberly Wâ€™s (Hotel Phillips)  Reserved 5 rooms for a tradeshow for staff. Out of the 5, only three stayed, with good reason. The hotel was dirty, dingy and horribly taken care of. For the price we paid and being a Hilton Honors patron, I was dismayed. One room had dust and debris on the headboard of the bed, as well as spatters of blood on the bed and phone. The closet contained items from past residents. Another staffer tried to shower, only to have the water up to her calves and a hidden hole that flooded her room while showering. Another staffer showed up only to be told she had no reservation - although confirmed and reconfirmed. Sent an incident report to Hilton parent, as I am sure they are unaware that their brand name is attached to such an atrocity. Horrible.

Ryan...I researched room 511 for Hotel Phillips and it said: Room 511 is a 2016 horror film, not a room at the Hotel Phillips. The Hotel Phillips is a historic hotel in Kansas City, Missouri, and doesn't have a room numbered 511. It has a total of 217 rooms, located on 12th Street in downtown Kansas City. Ryan when you check for bedbugs, always bring traps, and lift the corners of the mattress and look there where they hide, look under the pillows and look for blood under the pillows or on the sheets. They hide during the day, but at night they come out to party. Just some advice. Iâ€™ve had them before and so I really wouldnâ€™t want you to bring home bed bugs without knowing it, because you wonâ€™t until they make a home in yours. Room 511 is a room in a horror film from 2016 called Room 511. The film is about two men who stay at a hotel room known for wild parties and encounter two women. They find that the day may never end and that every attempt to leave seems to stall. The film's tagline is "There's a party in Room 511. Anyone can enter, no one can leave".

i
I moved to the Detroit area about 2 years ago now. Detroit is an interesting city because some parts are really nice now, others are still not, and there's a few like that hotel, where they're somewhere in between. They seem superficially nice but you can tell they're trying really hard to move forward. I think Detroit is actually a great city overall, you just need to know which places to avoid, and they're pretty obvious. I think nothing explains Detroit better than the Zillow listings. You have $5000 dollar house and $5000000 houses all listed as "Detroit, MI."

hey ryan.. i heard you say 2 megaBYTES to 2Mbps when its 2 megaBITS. it'd be 2 megaBYTES if it was MBps. 1MB=8Mb.. so technically the speed was 0.25 MEGABYTES/s and not 2 megabytes/s which is more slow than you think.. cheers

22:43 basically what ERT said was â€œThe Magnolia Hotel, despite claims of being a "Premier Boutique Hotel," does not live up to expectations. Numerous negative reviews proved accurate, leaving a dissatisfied stay. The Durham Museum initially booked the stay, and despite efforts to change the reservation, the Magnolia Hotel became the only option. Upon arrival, it became clear that the hotel fell short. The room lacked basic amenities, such as a fridge and microwave, and the shower posed a safety risk. Many previous guests had experienced unauthorized charges and encountered bedbugs. The musty smell and appearance further added to the disappointment. The overall experience was marred by discarded food on the floor, a sleepless night before important shows, and unhelpful staff. The hotel placed unnecessary holds on the credit card, causing financial strain. Attempts to communicate with management were met with silence and rudeness. This lack of accountability and service standards prompted a complaint to the bank, the Durham Museum, Better Business Bureau, and the Nebraska Attorney General's office. The reviewer suggests avoiding the Magnolia Hotel and opting for the more satisfactory Embassy Suites instead.â€

You can't just see bedbugs, LOL. If you could then they'd literally be extinct by now (because they literally can _only_ survive with humans). They hide (typically inside mattresses, but can also be in walls or pillows or cushioning or such) until you're sleeping.  Also a lot of people are asymptomatic to their bites, so won't even notice the bedbugs (and bedbugs never carry any disease), so sleeping a long time somewhere without bite marks is not an indication that there is no infestation.

2Mbps is "2 Mega bits per second"  There are 8 bits (b) per byte (B).  2Mbps = 0.25 MBps  So, if your file to download is 1GB and you have 2Mbps bandwidth, it will take 1hr and 7 minutes. If you had 2MBps as you had said, a 1GB file download would take about 8 minutes.

Those aren't "megabytes" per second. Those are "megabits" per second. There are 8 bits in a byte, so to convert to megabytes per second, you divide by 8.  This is like the difference in 6 feet vs 6 inches.

While opinions about who the best YouTuber is can vary widely depending on personal preferences, there are several reasons why many people admire Ryan Trahan.   Firstly, Ryan's content is diverse and engaging, catering to a wide audience. From vlogs documenting his daily life to thought-provoking commentary on various topics, Ryan offers something for everyone. His ability to switch between different types of content keeps his audience entertained and coming back for more.  Secondly, Ryan's authenticity shines through in his videos. He is not afraid to be vulnerable and share personal experiences with his audience, which fosters a strong connection with his viewers. This authenticity resonates with many people, who appreciate his honesty and transparency.  Additionally, Ryan's work ethic is commendable. He consistently uploads high-quality content and puts a lot of effort into each video he creates. Whether he's conducting experiments, collaborating with other creators, or simply sharing his thoughts, Ryan always delivers content that is well-produced and entertaining.  Furthermore, Ryan's positive attitude and sense of humor make his videos enjoyable to watch. He has a natural charisma that draws people in and makes them feel like they're hanging out with a friend. His lighthearted approach to even serious topics helps to make his content relatable and engaging.  Overall, Ryan Trahan has earned a loyal following on YouTube due to his diverse content, authenticity, work ethic, and engaging personality. While opinions about the best YouTuber may vary, there's no denying that Ryan has made a significant impact on the platform and continues to entertain and inspire his audience.
